medical_history.chief_complaint: Diffuse abdominal, back and chest discomfort.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient has been experiencing epigastric and right upper quadrant abdominal discomfort that radiates to her chest and back bilaterally for the past 4 days, associated with nonbilious, nonbloody vomiting and chills. Patient had similar complaints previously and was sent to the ED, where workup noted rising LFTs and TBILI, with evidence of choledocholithiasis. However, her LFTs resolved spontaneously as an outpatient after her last admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Polyarthritis on chronic prednisone, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, chronic kidney disease, vertigo, low back pain, degenerative disc disease (lumbar spine), osteoarthritis, osteoporosis, dyspepsia, exertional dyspnea, age-related vision problems, balance problems, and post-menopausal bleeding.
